channel.title: Player right help o.O
channel.description:
Hey guys I've only just now began to notice that I'm only a co owner even when I change my rights to 3 anyone know how to make it so I'm the real owner I have seen posts before about the owner player right being hidden but I wouldn't know what to do to find either way. =o, also I will Rep++ to Whom can help.
- Thanks, Hollowfied

item.title: Player right help o.O
item.dc:creator: @whattehp406 whattehp406
item.description:
@whattehp406 wrote:

just change every name of the prev owner to yours in client.java

Read full topic

item.title: Player right help o.O
item.dc:creator: @Stiflex Stiflex
item.description:
@Stiflex wrote:

[quote=“i_hollowfied, post:1, topic:368944”]Hey guys I’ve only just now began to notice that I’m only a co owner even when I change my rights to 3 anyone know how to make it so I’m the real owner I have seen posts before about the owner player right being hidden but I wouldn’t know what to do to find either way. =o, also I will Rep++ to Whom can help.

  • Thanks, Hollowfied[/quote]

well, as i Understud. You are a co-owner lets say when you do ::yell it says: Co-owner:(name): Hello… to make you’re self look like an owner, you have to go to client.java if you’re using 317 ofc… and find the ::yell command. if im not mistaken. And find the owner yell line… replace that name to you’res and it will show you’re name… and if you want to make commands that only you can do instead of (playerRights == 2) place you’re name… tbh i might not help bcuz almost all source’s are different
Ohh, and if you need to change the welcome text, find the words that the text says in client.java and find the owner version… change the name to yours…

Read full topic

This is why people need to post more information.

Read full topic

@TheCyberMan wrote:

You never know what source he has…

Read full topic

item.title: Player right help o.O
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

playerRights = 4 is admin without a crown, AKA hidden admin. This is only useful for keeping tabs on people breaking the rules without being noticed. 4 is hardly ever implemented into the core structure.

I think he means he noticed he was only 2 in his character.txt, so changed to 3 and now administrator priveledges don’t work because obviously everything is set to coincide with playerRights == 2, by default.

Read full topic

item.title: Player right help o.O
item.dc:creator: @TheCyberMan TheCyberMan
item.description:
@TheCyberMan wrote:

Try Player Rights=4

If that doesn’t help, it’s because in the welcome screen it says your co owners for if you make any other owners. If you look in the client.java (317) or commands.java (508) you’ll see that many commands will say specifically one player name. Make the player name yours to be the true owner.

Read full topic

item.title: Player right help o.O
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

If you’ve got all the code set to playerRights == 2 (commands, accessing areas etc.) and you’re set as playerRights = 3 in your character.txt (because you just realised you was only co-owner) then you’ll need to set everything from playerRights == 2 to playerRights == 3.

Only then will swapping from 2 to 3 take effect.

Most servers now have normal players, player moderators and administrators because they don’t want other people being an admin on their server (decent servers anyway), therefore just use playerRights == 2 as a default.

Read full topic
